summary: The success of the census depends in large part on the Census Bureau's ability to record every location where a person resides. An ever-changing housing inventory and "hidden" housing—such as a converted attic or shed that may not show up in records—make this huge task even more difficult. As part of a test run, census workers went door-to-door to try to record each housing unit...
title: 2020 Census: Actions Needed to Improve In-Field Address Canvassing Operation
